div1.head: Military Orders for Newell R. Colby, November 19, 1900
div1.p:
Adjutant General's
[unclear]
OFFICE.
DEC 3 1900
ROLLS DIVISION.

ORDERS, BOOKS, BLANKS & D.C. DIV.
A. G. O.
RECD. NOV 22 1900

SPECIAL ORDERS, }
No. 3. }

HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA,
Havana, November 19, 1900.

1. Major James W. Dawes, Additional Paymaster, U. S.
Volunteers, is hereby assigned to duty at Columbia Bar-
racks, Cuba.

2. The following named privates of the Hospital Corps,
U. S. Army, having been examined by the boards of medical
officers convened by paragraphs 2 and 3, Special Orders No.
181, current series, Headquarters Division of Cuba, to
determine their fitness for the position of acting hospital
steward, and having been found qualified, are hereby
detailed as Acting Hospital Stewards, and they will report
for duty to the commanding officers of the stations set op-
posite their respective names, viz:
John C. Courtney, Morro Castle, Santiago;
Andrew Pearson, Cabaña Barracks;
Joseph Roemhild, Holguin;
Legare J. LaMar, Manzanillo.

The Quartermaster's Department will furnish the neces-
sary transportation.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

3. Acting Hospital Steward Henry C. Krause, Hospital
Corps, U. S. Army, is hereby relieved from duty at Caba-
ña Barracks, and will report to the Chief Surgeon of the
Department for temporary duty.

4. The following assignment of paymasters to pay troops
on the muster of November 30, 1900, is hereby made:

Major Francis S. Dodge, Paymaster, U. S. Army, Chief
Paymaster of the Department, in person, at Cabaña Bar-
racks and at the posts and batteries constituting the de-
fenses of Havana; and by express, Camp McKenzie, Puerto
Principe;

Major James W. Dawes, U. S. Volunteers,in person, at
Columbia Barracks;

Major Otto Becker, U. S. Volunteers, in person, at Ham-
ilton and Rowell Barracks; by express, at Ciego de Avila;

Major John R. Lynch, U. S. Volunteers, in person, at
Morro Castle; by express, at San Luis, Guantánamo, Man-
zanillo, Bayamo and Holguín.
